firmware_notes: Compatible con versiones de firmware desde 1986 hasta 7.x. Algunos comandos requieren PK-232MBX o versiones específicas de firmware.

Mode Switching.help: Switches to CW mode. Adjust CWSPEED before use.
Switches to RTTY mode. Check ABAUD and SHIFT.
Switches to ASCII mode. Similar to RTTY but for ASCII.
Switches to Baudot RTTY mode (5-bit code).
Switches to Weather FAX receive mode (requires appropriate firmware).
Sends Ctrl+C to return to command mode.

Connection.help:
Initiates an AX.25 connection to the specified station.

Examples:
  C DG2GSV
  C DB0UAL VIA DG2GSV
  C DB0FHN VIA DB0UAL,DB0RBS

The TNC sends SABM frames and waits for UA. If no response after RETRY attempts, it gives up.
Sends a DISC frame to end the current AX.25 connection gracefully.
Enters converse mode. Press Ctrl+C to exit. In converse, everything you type is transmitted.

Sets the mode to enter when a connection is established.

CONV - enter converse mode
TRANS - enter transparent mode

Default: CONV

When ON, prevents automatic disconnect due to timeout or RETRY failures.

Default: OFF

Monitoring.help:
Controls which packets are displayed:

0 - Monitor OFF
1 - UI frames only (beacons, unproto)
2 - I frames (connected data)
3 - I + UI + SABM + DISC
4 - All above + UA + DM
5 - All above + supervisory (RR, RNR, REJ)
6 - All frames

Default: 4

Controls monitoring during active connection. Uses same values as MONITOR.

Default: 0 (off)

Controls monitoring of connected stations' traffic:

0 - OFF
1 - UI frames
2 - I + UI frames
3 - C + D + I + UI
4 - UA + DM + C + D + I + UI
5 - All supervisory + above
6 - All frames

Default: 0

When ON, monitors packets from connected stations as well as unproto.

Default: ON
Displays a list of stations heard recently with timestamps.

Filters which stations to monitor.

MFROM ONLY - show only listed calls
MFROM ALL - show all calls
MFROM call1,call2 - add to monitor list

Default: ALL

Filters packets by destination address. Syntax same as MFROM.

Default: ALL

When ON, adds timestamp to each monitored packet.

Default: OFF

When ON, displays protocol information in monitored packets.

Default: OFF

Station Setup.help:
Sets the callsign used for all transmissions.

Examples:
  MY EA7HQL
  MY EA7HQL-5

SSID (-0 to -15) can be appended. Default SSID is -0.
You MUST set this before connecting.

Sets an alternate callsign. TNC responds to both MYCALL and MYALIAS.

Default: none

Controls whether the TNC echoes back characters you type.

ECHO ON  – TNC echoes input
ECHO OFF – no echo (use if terminal has local echo)

Default: ON

Adds LF after each CR received.

Default: OFF

Master flow control switch.

ON - enables flow control (see XFLOW for type)
OFF - disables all flow control

Default: ON

ON - XON/XOFF software flow control
OFF - hardware RTS/CTS flow control

Set OFF for USB serial adapters.

Default: ON

When ON, reduces verbose prompts and messages.

Default: OFF

Performs a warm restart without clearing parameters.

Use after changing baud rate or certain parameters.

Packet Timing.help:
Delay between keying TX and sending data.

Values: 0-120 (10ms units)
Default: 30 (300ms)

Guidelines:
  Direct VHF: 20-30
  Via repeater: 40-60
  HF: 30-50

Seconds to wait for ACK before retransmitting.

Values: 1-15
Default: 3

Guidelines:
  VHF direct: 3
  Via digipeater: 5-7
  HF: 8-15

Max retransmission attempts before disconnect.

Values: 0-15
Default: 10

CSMA persistence. Higher = more aggressive transmit.

Values: 0-255
Default: 63

Probability = (PERSIST + 1) / 256
  63 = 25% (shared channels)
  255 = always transmit (point-to-point)

Time units to wait after channel clear before transmitting.

Values: 0-255
Default: 0

Used to avoid collisions. Each unit = 10ms.

Time between PERSIST checks.

Values: 0-255 (10ms units)
Default: 10 (100ms)

Lower values increase throughput but may cause collisions.

Delay between AX.25 frames (10ms units).

Values: 0-255
Default: 0

Time to hold PTT after last frame (10ms units).

Values: 0-255
Default: 0

Packet Advanced.help:
Maximum data bytes per AX.25 I-frame.

Values: 0-255 (0 = 256)
Default: 128

Guidelines:
  HF (300 baud): 40-80
  VHF (1200 baud): 128
  VHF (9600 baud): 255

Smaller = fewer retransmissions on noisy links.

Max unacknowledged I-frames before waiting for ACK.

Values: 1-7
Default: 4

Guidelines:
  HF: 1-2
  VHF simplex: 3-4
  VHF full-duplex: 7

When ON, TNC acts as a digipeater for packets addressed to MYCALL or MYALIAS.

Default: OFF

When ON, displays packets that have been digipeated.

Default: OFF

When ON, passes packets even with CRC errors (for monitoring).

Default: OFF

When ON, allows 8-bit data in converse mode.

Default: OFF

ON - use AX.25 v2.0 protocol
OFF - use AX.25 v1.0 protocol

Default: ON

Controls which stations can connect to you:

ALL - accept from anyone
NONE - reject all
ONLY call1,call2 - accept only listed
NO call1,call2 - reject listed

Default: ALL

Sets checksum/CRC method:

0 - CRC-CCITT
1 - CRC-16
2 - Checksum

Default: 0

Beacon & Unproto.help:
Sets beacon transmission:

EVERY n - send beacon every n×10 seconds
AFTER n - send once after n×10 sec of inactivity

Values: 0-250 (0 = off)
Default: 0

Example: BEACON EVERY 90 (send every 15 minutes)

Sets the text for beacon packets. Max 120 characters.

Example: BTEXT EA7HQL VHF Packet in Madrid

Default: empty

Sets destination for beacons and unconnected packets.

Examples:
  UNPROTO CQ
  UNPROTO BEACON VIA WIDE2-2
  UNPROTO APRS VIA RELAY,WIDE

Default: CQ

Immediately sends an identification packet.

Useful for sending final ID before shutdown.

When ON, adds timestamp to connect messages.

Default: OFF

Connect Messages.help:
Message sent when someone connects to you. Max 120 characters.

Example: CTEXT Welcome to EA7HQL - I'm QRT, leave msg

Default: empty

When ON, sends CTEXT when stations connect.

Default: OFF

When ON, sounds terminal bell when connection established.

Default: OFF

Date & Time.help:
Sets the internal clock.

Format: YY=year, MM=month, DD=day, HH=hour, MM=minute, SS=second

Example: DAYTIME 250214173000 (Feb 14, 2025, 17:30:00)

When ON, includes date with time in timestamps.

Default: OFF

When ON, adds timestamp to cmd: prompt.

Default: OFF

CW Parameters.help:
Sets the CW sending and receiving speed in words per minute.

Values: 5-99
Default: 20

Common speeds:
  15 – slow, comfortable for beginners
  20 – standard QSO speed
  30+ – contest/advanced

Sets the receive CW filter center frequency.

Values: 200-2000 Hz
Default: 800

Match this to your transceiver's sidetone frequency for best decoding.

CW Parameters.desc: CW ID at end of transmission
CW Parameters.help:
When ON, the TNC sends your callsign in CW at the end of each transmission.

Default: OFF

Toggles between wide (1000Hz) and narrow (200Hz) shift for CW.

Default: OFF (narrow)

AMTOR Parameters.help:
Initiates an AMTOR ARQ (Automatic Repeat Request) connection.

The selcall is a 4-character code derived from the target station's callsign.

Example:
  AC DGKV

Sets your 4-character AMTOR selective call.

The selcall is derived from your callsign. Check your TNC manual or use online calculators to determine it.

Starts an AMTOR FEC (Forward Error Correction) broadcast.

FEC is a one-way mode – no acknowledgement from the receiving station. Good for CQ calls and broadcasts.
Places the TNC in AMTOR standby, listening for incoming ARQ calls addressed to your selcall.

Sets ARQ mode timeout in seconds.

Values: 0-255
Default: 120

Transmit delay for AMTOR (10ms units).

Values: 0-255
Default: 30

RTTY/ASCII Parameters.help:
Sets baud rate for Baudot/ASCII RTTY modes.

Common values:
45 - standard Baudot
50 - 50 baud
75 - 75 baud
110 - standard ASCII
300 - fast ASCII

Default: 45

Sets RTTY mark-space shift frequency.

Common values:
170 - standard amateur RTTY
200 - 200 Hz
425 - 425 Hz
850 - wide shift

Default: 170

Inverts the sense of mark and space tones.

Try toggling if you receive garbled text. Some stations use inverted polarity.

Default: OFF

Sets data bits for ASCII RTTY mode.

5 - Baudot
7 - standard ASCII
8 - 8-bit ASCII/binary

Default: 5

Controls RTTY word output formatting.

Default: OFF

Inverts all data bits.

Default: OFF

Reverses transmit data polarity in Baudot/ASCII/AMTOR.

Default: OFF

Radio Interface.help:
ON - use VHF port (J6, typically 1200 baud)
OFF - use HF port (J4, typically 300 baud)

Default: ON

Sets the packet modem baud rate.

Common values:
300 - HF packet
1200 - VHF packet (most common)
9600 - high-speed VHF (requires G3RUH modem)

Default: 1200

Enters calibration mode for adjusting transmitter audio levels.

The TNC transmits alternating tones. Press any key to exit.

Use WIDESHFT to toggle between narrow (200Hz) and wide (1000Hz) shift.

Mailbox (MBX only).help:
Sets the callsign for mailbox operation (PK-232MBX only).

Example: MYMAIL EA7HQL-1

Default: none

Enables/disables mailbox functionality (PK-232MBX only).

Default: OFF
Checks if you have new mail in the mailbox (PK-232MBX only).

Sets the mailbox greeting message (PK-232MBX only). Max 120 chars.

Default: empty

Enables monitoring of mailbox activity (PK-232MBX only).

Default: OFF

Special Characters.help:
Sets the character that cancels current input line.

Default: $18 (Ctrl+X)

Sets the character that cancels current packet.

Default: $19 (Ctrl+Y)

Sets the character for destructive backspace.

Default: $08 (Backspace)

Sets the character that redisplays current input line.

Default: $12 (Ctrl+R)

Sets the character that manually sends a packet.

Default: $0D (Enter)

Character to switch between packet channels.

Default: $7C (|)

Flow Control.help:
Sets the XON character for software flow control.

Default: $11 (Ctrl+Q)

Set to $00 to disable.

Sets the XOFF character for software flow control.

Default: $13 (Ctrl+S)

Set to $00 to disable.

Character TNC sends to computer to resume transmission.

Default: $11 (Ctrl+Q)

Character TNC sends to computer to pause transmission.

Default: $13 (Ctrl+S)

Enables software flow control in transparent mode.

Default: OFF

Display & Headers.help:
Sets packet header display format:

0 - no headers
1 - FROM>TO
2 - FROM>TO,VIA
3 - full AX.25 header

Default: 1

Sets number of lines per screen for paging.

Values: 0-255 (0 = no paging)
Default: 0

When ON, adds CR to received packet data.

Default: OFF

KISS Mode.help:
Enables KISS protocol mode for host programs.

KISS mode disables command mode and passes raw frames.

Default: OFF

Enables binary HOST mode for computer control.

HOST mode uses 2-letter mnemonics for all commands.

Default: OFF

When ON, disables AX.25 protocol layer (for KISS).

Default: OFF

Enables host mode polling.

Default: OFF

When ON, uses PERSIST algorithm. When OFF, uses DWAIT.

Default: ON

Serial Port.help:
Sets serial port parity:

0 - no parity
1 - odd parity
2 - even parity

Default: 0

Enables transmit flow control.

Default: ON

Information.help:
Shows TNC parameter values.

Options:
  (none) or Z - all settings
  A - ASYNC parameters
  C - Character parameters
  F - FAX parameters
  I - ID parameters
  L - Link parameters
  M - Monitor parameters
  R - RTTY parameters
  T - Timing parameters

Single parameter: DISP PACLEN
Displays current connection status and channel information.
Explains why last connection attempt failed.

Reset.help:
Resets ALL parameters to factory defaults.

WARNING: Erases callsign and all settings.

Use RESTART for warm reboot without clearing settings.

Special Keys.help: Sends Ctrl+C (0x03) to return to the cmd: prompt from converse or data mode.
Sends ESC (0x1B). Some TNCs use this for special functions.
Sends a serial BREAK signal. Used for autobaud detection or hardware reset on some TNCs.

connectors.Computer Port: DB-25 RS-232 DCE. Pin 2: RxD (in from computer), Pin 3: TxD (out to computer), Pin 4: RTS (in), Pin 5: CTS (out), Pin 7: GND, Pin 8: DCD (out), Pin 20: DTR (in). IMPORTANT: Do NOT connect pins 9-25!
connectors.Radio 1 (J4, HF): 5-pin Molex. Pin 1: RX audio in, Pin 2: TX audio out (AFSK), Pin 3: Squelch in, Pin 4: GND, Pin 5: PTT out (active low, grounds when transmitting).
connectors.CW Key Output: J9 = positive keying (closes to +V), J10 = negative keying (closes to GND).
connectors.FSK Output: 8-pin IDC TTL header. Pin 3: GND, Pin 8: FSK (mark/space levels).
connectors.Speaker: 3.5mm rear panel jack (monitor output only, NOT an input).
connectors.Power: 2.1mm coaxial, center positive, +12V DC nominal (11-16V acceptable), 500mA typical consumption.
connectors.Battery Backup: Internal: 3× AA batteries or lithium cell for parameter memory backup. Remove jumper if batteries not installed.

notes.firmware_versions: Original PK-232 (1986), PK-232MBX (1989, integrated mailbox), firmware updates through 7.x added Pactor, Gateway modes, GPS support.
notes.rs232_wiring: PK-232 is DCE (Data Communications Equipment). Most computers are DTE. Use straight-through cable with pins 2↔3 swapped: Computer pin 2→PK-232 pin 3, Computer pin 3→PK-232 pin 2.
notes.baud_rates: Terminal baud: usually 9600 or 19200. Set same on computer and TNC. Use RESTART after changing.
notes.kiss_setup: To enter KISS mode: AWLEN 8, PARITY 0, RESTART, PACKET, START 0, STOP 0, XON 0, XOFF 0, XFLOW OFF, CONMODE TRANS, HPOLL OFF, KISS ON, RAWHDLC ON, PPERSIST ON, HOST ON
